title: Git-controlled files can be annexed again without .gitattributes rule
body:
I have cloned a Git repository and transformed it into a dataset.
If I save modifications to files that were under version control with Git, these files will be annexed.

```
╭─adina@muninn /tmp
╰─➤ git clone git@github.com:adswa/data-version-control.git blabla        
Cloning into 'blabla'...
remote: Enumerating objects: 82, done.
remote: Total 82 (delta 0), reused 0 (delta 0), pack-reused 82
Receiving objects: 100% (82/82), 12.48 KiB | 2.50 MiB/s, done.
Resolving deltas: 100% (18/18), done.
(handbook) ╭─adina@muninn /tmp
╰─➤ cd blabla && datalad create -f
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/blabla 
[INFO   ] Invalid command: 'git-annex-shell 'configlist' '/~/adswa/data-version-control.git''
|   You appear to be using ssh to clone a git:// URL.
|   Make sure your core.gitProxy config option and the
|   GIT_PROXY_COMMAND environment variable are NOT set. 
[INFO   ] Remote origin does not have git-annex installed; setting annex-ignore
|   This could be a problem with the git-annex installation on the remote. Please make sure that git-annex-shell is available in PATH when you ssh into the remote. Once you have fixed the git-annex installation, run: git annex enableremote origin 
╭─adina@muninn /tmp/blabla on master
╰─➤ echo 123456 >> src/train.py 
(handbook) ╭─adina@muninn /tmp/blabla on master!
╰─➤ datalad save
add(ok): /tmp/blabla/src/train.py (file)
save(ok): /tmp/blabla (dataset)
action summary:
  add (ok: 1)
  save (ok: 1)
(handbook) ╭─adina@muninn /tmp/blabla on master
╰─➤ ls -l src
total 12
-rw-r--r-- 1 adina adina  645 Sep  3 17:40 evaluate.py
-rw-r--r-- 1 adina adina 1231 Sep  3 17:40 prepare.py
lrwxrwxrwx 1 adina adina  123 Sep  3 17:41 train.py -> ../.git/annex/objects/Vm/Pp/MD5E-s1331--fb25f5559570b281f29174886b677bc2.py/MD5E-s1331--fb25f5559570b281f29174886b677bc2.py
```

I somewhat get why this happens (no largefiles rule), but its a bit inconvenient.
